SDSJap

......Is often the arguement used by people wanting gun control
 
 and its a load of bullsh*t, Im in the SD Highway patrol, and every one and his dog has a gun here, I feel safe knowing that fact, an example:
 
 In training I was shown a tape, to show why not to let my guard down an officer pulled a man over for speeding
 
 The officer went to the front of the truck and smelled booze, he told the man to get out and stand infront of the cruiser, he found liquor in the truck and went to arrest the man, when he did the man back handed him, knocked him to the ground and started punching him in the face, a few seconds latter a civilian pulled up and pulled a shotgun on the assailant, scared him back into his truck and took off, by this time the officer was unconscious and the civilian laid his shotgun on the cruiser's hood(thats how I know what it was, you couldnt see the civilian before this) and used the radio to call an ambulance in
 
 
 further more, as a retired Marine, I took an oath to protect the US Constitution against enemies, both foreign and domestic, anyone who wants Gun Control fits into that second catagory of enemy
 
 as far as that "documentary" http://www.hardylaw.net/Truth_About_Bowling.html

It's not surprising that the Americans needed the help of the French to win the Revolutionary War. Only one third of American colonists were patriots (those who wanted American Independence). About one third of the American colonists were loyalists (they were loyal to Great Britain). The loyalists wanted the Britain to win the war. Another third were neutral. This is according to what John Adams estimated, 
 "John Adams estimated that one third of the colonials were Loyalists; probably another third were neutral, apathetic, or opportunistic."
 http://www.encyclopedia.com/html/L/Loyalist.asp 
 
 After the British were defeated, many of the loyalists moved to Canada or went back to England.
